results.title: Rearing dairy calves
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Correct methods for rearing calves. Stresses individual feeding from buckets. To prevent digestive troubles and worm infestation, paddocks must be rotated. Calves must be drenched to prevent worms and if necessary vaccinated for black leg. Adequate clean and draught-proof shelter must be provided. Procedure for dehorning calves is also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Anderson and Tasmanian Government Film Unit

results.title: Realm of the wild
results.creator_credit: Carl Stearns Clancy and United States. Forest Service
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the work of the National Forest Service in the USA in preserving wild game. The film was shot entirely in National parks and reserves, and has many beautiful sequences showing the birds and animals in their natural surroundings. The Canada goose, ducks, owls, Canada jays, sage hens, squirrels, moose, deer, buffaloes, elk, mountain goats, sheep, ptarmigan, and many animals and birds are observed.

results.title: Really Rosie
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sendak, Sheldon Riss and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Based on books by Maurice Sendak with music by Carole King. Convinced of her limitless talent, Rosie sweeps the neighbourhood Nutshell Kids into the spotlight of her pretend movie. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Reality bites : sex, STDs and contraception
results.creator_credit: Liolja Davis and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This program explores sexuality issues for young people, highlighting sexual identity, sexual diversity, relationships and communication, sexually transmitted diseases and contraception. Understanding sex and sexuality is a key component addressed in the program, as is decision making, being sexually active, practicing safe sex, and dealing with unwanted pregnancies.

results.title: Ready when you are Mr McGill
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Michael Dunlop and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: A film about the making of a television film, which gently satirises all the members of a film unit, and is a lesson in how not to direct a television play. The story is seen through the eyes of Joe McGill, a professional television extra given his first speaking part of two lines. But everything that can possibly go wrong in location filming, does go wrong. Stars Jack Shepard.

results.title: Ready to type
results.brief_description: Designed for showing to students beginning typing classes. Shows the importance of developing a procedure for getting ready to type. A comparison is made between two students, one of whom follows a pattern of procedure and the other who commences work without any preparation.

results.title: Ready for action
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Australian news and Information Bureau and Forestry and Timber Bureau (Australia)
results.brief_description: Film trailer on bushfire prevention. Summer always brings the curse of fire. Photographed at a fire-control field day held at Wyong, N.S.W., this short film illustrates how firemen prepare for the threat of fire. They overhaul their organisation, communications equipment and gear; safeguard buildings before the fire season commences; practise in using fire-fighting equipment; construct fire-breaks and practice mopping up after a fire.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Australian news and Information Bureau and Forestry and Timber Bureau (Australia)

results.title: Reading photographs
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
The works of specific photographers are examined to illustrate that visual communication carries more emotional, political and cultural impact than verbal communication. Warns the viewer to be aware of various visual stimuli.
